result.execSummary: Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyler James Schewe

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Heather. 
Case called: 
INCLUDES: 22CM381, 22CF476. 
State appears by ADA Alex Lech.  Defendant appears from MCJ via Zoom, with Atty Heather Roehr, in person.

ADA Lech indicates an amended complaint has been filed. 

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.  Reserve Jurisdiction. 
Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Preserved. 

Defendant is on PO hold.

COURT ORDERS: $5,000.00 cash bond to cover both files. 

CONDITIONS: 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol.  
- Report to ATTIC Corrections Services within one business day of release.  Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level 3 supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening. 
 
Defendant's Phone: 715-297-6782

DATES:
RH: 4/27/22 @ 1:00 p.m. Courtroom B.
PH: 5/2/22 @ 11:20 a.m. 

Adjourned: 2:40 p.m.
INCLUDES 22CF476 & 22CM381: No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents. Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of alcohol. Maintain absolute sobriety.

Clerk: Amanda.
Case called at 2:24 pm.
INCLUDES: 22CF476 & 22CM381. 
State appears by ADA Alex Lech. Defendant appears from MCJ, and by Attorney Heather Roehr.
Date and Time set for IA; 

Attorney Roehr is requesting to address Probable Cause today and adjourn IA. 
No objections; Court GRANTS. 

State recites history of matters; 
Defendant is on PO HOLD. 
Attorney Roehr makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: $2500 cash bond - CONDITIONS: 
- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from, and no possession of alcohol. 
- Maintain absolute sobriety. 

>>FUTURE DATES: 
AIA: 4/22 at 2:00 pm. 


Adj: 2:28 pm.
